intro: Pervillaea phillipsonii, commonly known as the Mexican dandelion, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and parts of Central America. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and distinctive leaf morphology. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its leaves are usually lance-shaped and covered in fine hairs, while its flowers produce a yellow-orange bloom. Pervillaea phillipsonii is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits.
